title: Cheesecake Crepe Roll-Ups Recipe
description: Tender, thin crepes are rolled up with berry-flavored cream cheese, sliced into pinwheels, and served cold. Just perfect for a breakfast in bed, Mother's Day, or to treat your Valentine.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Crepes Sweet Cheesecake Crepe Roll-Ups 4.6 (23) 18 Reviews 10 Photos A perfect breakfast treat for brunches, Valentine's Day, breakfast in bed, or Mother's Day. Submitted by Madelynn Updated on February 7, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 10 10 10 10 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 2 hrs Total Time: 2 hrs 20 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 4 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour 2 tablespoons milk 2 eggs 2 teaspoons honey 1 pinch salt 2 tablespoons butter, divided 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened ½ cup confectioners' sugar ¼ cup mixed frozen berries, slightly thawed 1 tablespoon confectioners' sugar, or as needed Directions Whisk together the flour, milk, eggs, honey, and salt in a bowl to make a smooth batter. Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a nonstick crepe pan over medium heat until the foam disappears. Pour about 2 tablespoons of the batter into the pan, and swirl to cover the bottom of the pan with a thin layer of batter. Cook until the crepe is no longer runny, about 1 minute; flip and cook the other side for an additional 1 minute. Repeat with additional butter and crepe mix, to make 4 crepes. Set the crepes aside on paper towels. In a bowl, mix the cream cheese with 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar to make a creamy spread. Very gently stir in the berries. Spread the cream cheese filling evenly over the crepes and roll up. Refrigerate until chilled; slice in 1-inch sections to serve. I Made It Print 89 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Cheesecake Crepe Roll-Ups 01 of 10 Photo by  Jennifer Baker 02 of 10 Photo by  Jessie Walker 10/11/2020 03 of 10 Photo by  Trusted Brands 05/19/2020 04 of 10 Photo by  Rredrose Rredrose 01/11/2020 05 of 10 Photo by  Rredrose Rredrose 01/11/2020 06 of 10 Photo by  Rredrose Rredrose 01/11/2020 07 of 10 Photo by  amberL 02/01/2019 08 of 10 Photo by  Larry G 04/09/2017 09 of 10 Photo by  Sara Suwito 01/23/2016 It's delicious!! Thanks for the recipe 10 of 10 Photo by  Jennifer Baker 05/02/2012 This is the first time I've ever made crepes and they turned out wonderfully. I used fresh fruit since it's in season and the filled crepes are delicious. I would be very happy if my family made these for me for Mother's Day (hint, hint!). name: Madelynn
instructions: Whisk together the flour, milk, eggs, honey, and salt in a bowl to make a smooth batter.;Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a nonstick crepe pan over medium heat until the foam disappears. Pour about 2 tablespoons of the batter into the pan, and swirl to cover the bottom of the pan with a thin layer of batter. Cook until the crepe is no longer runny, about 1 minute; flip and cook the other side for an additional 1 minute. Repeat with additional butter and crepe mix, to make 4 crepes. Set the crepes aside on paper towels.;In a bowl, mix the cream cheese with 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar to make a creamy spread. Very gently stir in the berries. Spread the cream cheese filling evenly over the crepes and roll up. Refrigerate until chilled; slice in 1-inch sections to serve.
